item.title: Personal Cybersecurity Checklist
item.description: HOW TO STAY SECURE IN DANGEROUS TIMES (2021 EDITION) This guide has few areas, where one can improve his security standards. HUMAN FACTOR each protection can be broken by human and cause of human mistake verify who are you talking to, callback to your bank to check if it’s their employee asking suspicious questions your friend on Facebook needs some money urgently, call his mobile and confirm it your real inbox can also be a target of attack, someone can try to trick you into some payment end-user education is a must in your company VPN can make tracking you harder, assuming provider itself is not some malicious actor allows to bypass restrictions like geographic or law ones if you’re using hotspot, encrypts your traffic so other cannot spy on you in this public network do not trust completely VPN providers, they aren’t always honest about “zero logs policy” and can be hacked as well best bet is to go with your own VPN and don’t store logs there, great tool for it is algo for shady stuff, you can always rent VPS with BitCoins and provision it with your VPN…

item.title: Workspace Environment
item.description: Will write about my workspace, tools, terminal and so on. CLI Applications That You Should Know! usql - is a universal command-line interface for PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle Database, SQLite3, Microsoft SQL Server, and many other databases including NoSQL and non-relational databases! exa - exa is a modern replacement for the venerable file-listing command-line program ls that ships with Unix and Linux operating systems, giving it more features and better defaults

item.title: About
item.description: Name: Damian Age: 30 Job: DevOps Engineer Certifications: Offensive Security Certified Professional Certified Kubernetes Administrator Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist Google Cloud Associate Engineer AWS Certified Solutions Architect AWS Certified Security - Specialty

item.title: Linkbase
item.description: 26.06.2024 Docs as code is a broken promise Who Touched My GCP Project? Understanding the Principal Part in Cloud Audit Logs – Part 1 IAM Is The Worst Leveraging Nuclei Templates to Identify Risks and Threats in Critical Cloud Applications Terraform 1.8 provider functions for AWS, Google Cloud, and Kubernetes Private, secure, and seamless connectivity to Cloud SQL using Private Service Connect Go performance from version 1.0 to 1.22 Redis re-implemented with SQLite PostgreSQL Index Advisor State of DevSecOps The end of GitHub PATs: You can’t leak what you don’t have NSA Publishes Guidance for Strengthening AI System Security Microsoft Copilot for Security is a generative AI-powered security solution that helps increase the efficiency and capabilities of defenders to improve security outcomes at machine speed and scale, while remaining compliant to responsible AI principles Integrate Kubernetes policy-as-code solutions into Security Hub From Ground Zero to Production: Go’s Journey at Google The Kubenomicon was born of a desire to understand more about Kubernetes from an offensive perspective Our Journey Migrating to AWS IMDSv2 AWS Monitoring with EventBridge Effortlessly deploy a status page and start monitoring endpoints in minutes A simple script which implements different Cognito attacks such as Account Oracle or Priviledge Escalation exploit.
